choice.message: Well, hello there! I am {npc.name} the kobold. Don't you think my garden is just beautiful?
Why, hello there! I am {npc.name} the kobold. Don't you think my garden is just beautiful?

dialog.name: garden
dialog.message: Why yes! Just look around you! I use a specially crafted potion that keeps my garden looking nice. Do you want to see?

dialog.name: whynot
dialog.message: Here it is! Doesn't it smell wonderful?
You start feeling nauseous as soon as the potion is opened...
Oh right, sorry! Let me close it again... I forgot it has ingredients that make most creatures sick...
As the potion closes, you start feeling better again.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Well, hello there again! My garden is just beautiful, isn't it?

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: We won't forget what you have done for us, {activator.name}.
Please, if there's anything I can do for you, just ask.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Watch out, stranger. We seem to have an illness going on here.

dialog.name: illness
dialog.message: That is part of the problem... we're not quite sure. Our local priestess, Gwenty, has been unable to find a cure for it. If you want more information, you can find her down the stairs in the main building.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: I'm grateful for your help with the illness. Please, if you need anything, don't hesitate to ask.

part.name: Poisoned Waters
part.message: Gwenty, a priestess of Grunhilde has asked you to figure out why Fort Sether guards keep falling ill. She seems to suspect it's because of the water, in which case it might be work checking out the water wells.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Welcome, stranger. I'd like to help you by offering my usual priest services, however, the illness that is going on in the fort is keeping me rather busy, so if you'll excuse me...

dialog.name: illness
dialog.message: Well, if you're so curious, I can spare a few moments. Perhaps you might be able to help us...

Many guards are falling ill, one after another. Being the only priestess around, I'm quite busy tending the sick guards. However, I'm not able to completely cure them, as they just keep falling ill soon after I cure them...

dialog.name: reason
dialog.message: If only! If I wasn't so busy, I would probably be able to figure it out. But as it is...

dialog.name: see
dialog.message: Would you be willing to help us? I am afraid I can't solve this problem without some assistance...

dialog.name: help
dialog.message: Ah, yes! Thank you. Your help is much appreciated...
I'm not sure where the disease is originating from. The only thing I can think of is the water, which we get from an underground river of sorts.
It would certainly be worth investigating the river... perhaps something is going on down there. The fastest way to do that would be to climb down using one of the water wells in the fort.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: You agreed to help us {activator.name}, no?
I still suspect the cause of the illness is the water, which we get from an underground river of sorts.
It would certainly be worth investigating the river... perhaps something is going on down there. The fastest way to do that would be to climb down using one of the water wells in the fort.

dialog.name: whynot
dialog.message: Perhaps you should report your findings to Gwenty...

part.name: The Kobold Gardener
part.message: You found a kobold named Brownrott below Fort Sether, with a most extraordinary garden. He has shown you a potion he uses to make his garden grow well, and its smell drove you nauseous. Perhaps you should ask Gwenty, the priestess in Fort Sether, for advice.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Well? Have you investigated the water wells yet?

dialog.name: yes
dialog.message: You explain about Brownrott and his garden...
Indeed? So it was the water, like I thought... Well, I think I know how to mend this particular problem...

Here. Take that potion, and bring it to the kobold. Tell him he needs to mix it with his own. It should cancel out the negative effects it causes to us humans, but still make it effective for his garden. It might take some persuading, however...

part.name: Delivery of a Cure
part.message: Gwenty, the priestess in Fort Sether, has given you a potion to mix with Brownrott's one. He may need some persuading, however...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: So, have you convinced the kobold to mix his potion with the one I gave you?

dialog.name: working
dialog.message: Very well...

response.message: I lost the potion you gave me...

dialog.name: lost
dialog.message: What?! Well, it's not irreplaceable, but please, don't go wasting it and just convince the kobold to mix it with his potion... Here, take this spare one I have, and be more careful with it...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Well, hello there again! My garden is just bea--
You interrupt Brownrott and explain to him about the illness in Fort Sether and his potion...
Are you sure? Hmm... I don't know... I don't really trust anyone with my potion except myself... But perhaps... If you bring me something tasty, I might change my mind...

dialog.name: want
dialog.message: Spider hearts, of course, I want spider hearts - they are very tasty, but the spiders are dangerous.
Bring me 10 sword spider hearts, and I'll mix your potion with mine. You can find those spiders around in this cave. I usually stay far away from them, but their hearts sure are delicious...

part.name: The Kobold Delicacy
part.message: Just as you thought, Brownrott was very reluctant to mix his potion with yours, and has asked you to bring him 10 sword spider hearts first, which can be found by killing sword spiders below Fort Sether.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Bring me 10 sword spider hearts, and I'll mix your potion with mine. You can find those spiders around in this cave. I usually stay far away from them, but their hearts sure are delicious...

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: Mmm! Delicious sword spider hearts! I like you! Mmm! Alright, let's mix the potions then!
You hand the 10 sword spider hearts and the potion to Brownrott.
There! All done. Thank you again for the sword spider hearts! Mmm!
You should report the good news to Gwenty.

part.name: The Reward
part.message: After delivering the spider hearts to Brownrott, he mixed his potion with yours. You should report to Gwenty for a reward.

dialog.name: hello
dialog.message: So, have you convinced the kobold to mix his potion with the one I gave you?

dialog.name: yes
dialog.message: That's great news, {activator.name}! I knew I could count on you. You have my thanks, as well as that of all the people in the fort. We can now drink the water safely again...
As for your reward... Please, accept these coins from me. Also, since I'm no longer busy tending all the sick guards, I can now resume offering you my regular services.
